div.em: Current conditions as of 26 Apr 14:35 pm CDT

div.div: Sunny, with a high near 66. North wind 7 to 9 mph.
Mostly clear, with a low around 42. Light and variable wind becoming south around 6 mph in the evening.
A 30 percent chance of showers, mainly between 10am and 1pm. Partly sunny, with a high near 66. South wind 7 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph.

font.marquee: There will be NO school through April 30.

p.style: font: 400 16px/1.38 Times New Roman; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; text-decoration: none; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px;

span.style: background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: "bree serif",serif; font-size: 12pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Due to the school closure we have no choice, but to close all school property to the community. I do understand that this is a difficult time and this is the only place for our students to play and run around. The playground and ballfield and all school property will be closed . Thank you for your understanding during the school closure.

a.aria-label: Read more about School's Grounds Are Closed

div.p: The Hughes family learning during school closure.

a.aria-label: Read more about Learning At Home

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 1.26; margin-bottom: 0pt; margin-top: 0pt; orphans: 2; text-align: center; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;

color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: 1.26; margin-bottom: 0pt; margin-top: 0pt; orphans: 2; text-align: center; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;

p.b: The Governor has announced that we will not be returning to school for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. In the coming week we will have more guidance on Graduation and many other school issues. We do not have all the answers yet, but we will be working to get the information out to you as soon as we have it available. Thank you for your understanding in this matter and we will do our best to make this the best transition possible. Please check the website, Instagram, Facebook and I will be sending out Alertify notifications.

a.aria-label: Read more about A Note From Mr. Walker

span.style: background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; vertical-align: baseline; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: pre-wrap; word-spacing: 0px;

p.span: Lunch pick up will be from 9:00 am - 7:00 pm on Tuesday April 21, 2020. There is 5 days worth of lunch and breakfast in each sack. If you have any questions please call the office at 217-584-1355. Thank you and have a great day.

br.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Times New Roman; font-size: 16px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;

a.aria-label: Read more about Lunch Pick Up

h3.a: A Letter From The School Nurse

div.p: Please read this letter from the nurse.

a.aria-label: Read more about A Letter From The School Nurse

span.style: font-family: Marmelad, sans-serif; text-align: center; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

span.span: Our school's mission is to formally educate all students to high, yet personally appropriate, levels of academic performance while fostering positive growth in social/emotional behaviors and attitudes. We accept the responsibility to teach all students so that they can attain their maximum educational potential. Our vision is to create a safe K-12 school district, which strives for academic excellence and contributes to improving the community in which it operates.

a.aria-label: Read more about Welcome to Meredosia-Chambersburg Schools

div.p: Do you ever have school related photos you would like to have put in the yearbook? This year there is a way to share them with the yearbook online. Go to www.replayit.com and register. After you register, you can upload pictures. This site is a Jostens site.

a.aria-label: Read more about Share Your Photos

div.p: Please drive slowly! Keeping students safe is a top priority at MCSD. Watch out for students when driving through the parking lot. Please follow all posted signage when picking up students after school. The pick-up line is one way through the back of the school. Thank you.

a.aria-label: Read more about Please Drive Slowly

li.title: A Letter From The School Nurse
